column4: i often find it easier to just put winscp on the windows box . and access ubuntu via ssh  that way
you did install 'samba' package? and gave the user a samba password with 'sudo smbpasswd -a USERNAME' ?
im just going through what i normally do to get things going on a new system. :)
the problems are in a windows computer not ubuntu i haven't changed anything to my ubuntu computer
ahh.  i also always have identicval windows user name and password on the windows box.  Can the windows box access its own shares?
what? im not sharing files through same computer if thats what you're asking i have 2 computers one is windows and one is nix, os ubuntu which is what im on now
as a 'test'  i always make a share on both machines. and make sure they can access theor own local shares.
also instead of //HOSTnAME/share  you could try the ip#.
im just thinking through things ive done in the past to trouble shoot samba.
i have my config for samba set with computername and i did that in windows its telling me it can't find it
can the windows box even ping the lin box via  the name?  can it ping via ip?
i never had a problem before like i said i just reformatting the windows computer and got it all squared up so i shouldn't have a problem
im just spitting out trouble shooting 'things to try' to narrow down the problem.
no problem but i don't know what is the problem since i never did anything on the ubuntu side but remove xchat and the xchat folder
also see if the lin box can access a share on the windows box. (ie the reverse of what you want to do).  If that also fails. that may be a sign of network/firewall/windows setting issues also.
i can now access my windows files through ubuntu as i couldn't before but was able to access my ubuntu files in windows now its backwards if only i can get windows problem solved
i got a question do you know how i can set the program files folder in windows to share? the boxes are greyed out and i dunno how to make it to where i can access that on my ubuntu computer
or firecrotch are you two still around?
im in and out.. :)
did you get any of my recent posts

yea. Ping works via name and ip. Thats a good sign.  There should be some samba logs in /var/log somewhere.  You could tail -f, the log,  and try to connect via windows and see if the connection is rejected/tried/shown at all.
i have no problem now connecting to the windows sharing part i did before but firecrotch told me what i might have done which i turned off and now im able to connect to windows sharing folders
